p: The cell surface phenotype of DCs is used to determine the developmental and maturational status of DCs, imDCs, or mDCs [ 40]. The upregulation of HLA-DR, CD86, and CD83 expression on DCs is an indication of their maturation [ 41]. Moreover, low levels of CD83 mediate impaired T cells stimulation [ 42, 43]. In our hands, exposure to BSEO in the presence or absence of LPS, reduced significantly the expression of CD83, CD86, and HLA-DR on the surface of DCs, suggesting an immature phenotype of the produced DCs.
